reviewTitles: Buy new—bad charge port on my "Certified Refurbished" device
reviewBody: This product came with a BAD CHARGING PORT, that would not accept a MICRO USB charging cable. In order to charge the reader, I had to use a set of small electronics screwdrivers to carefully manipulate the female port pins into the proper location.Seems as though "Certified Refurbished" would mean that someone checked and certified the device for proper operation before selling it ever-so-slightly below the price of a new unit. Truly: buyers should go new and avoid the risk of defects like I have encountered.UPDATE: I have brought this up to three stars because Amazon reached out to ask what they, as a company that cares, could do to fix this problem. I did not ask for anything more than better QA/QC on refurbished products (I'm not the only charge port issue), and decided that since this reader is truly AMAZING: I'd better up my review to reflect the like. Definitely buy this model if you want amazing battery life and ultra-portable reading, but know that you are rolling the dice on quality if you choose refurbished.
postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019

reviewBody: Yay!! My original baby kindle (circa 2011) finally croaked and I tried to get by with my iPad. It was okay but I kept getting headaches and decided to take a chance on the refurbished Paperwhite. I just took a photo of it in full sun so people can see the quality and make their own decisions. I am really pleased with this device even though it is not the same as my original kindle. Change is sometimes difficult- the option of having the backlight is actually surprisingly nice. I also appreciate the touchscreen rather than the clunky search and peck control. This is a good alternative for those on a budget.

reviewBody: I'm leaving my initial review and issues below, but am upgrading my 1star review to 4.less than 10 min after posting my complaint another amazon representative reached out and was able to send a replacement Kindle. So far no issues with the new device and I was happy with the quick and courteous response from Amazon throughout.1* Disappointing,I’m not one to knock a refurbished product, but this one is still broken. The paper white is touted as having WEEKS of battery life but this little bugger won’t even last 5 hours from full charge. I have requested a replacement less than a week after purchase but they are now sold out and unable to offer a replacement only a refund. I’m disappointed since I was really looking forward to the battery life and waterproof aspects.

reviewBody: I love my regular Kindle, and although I usually use it in my home, there have been a few times now where i find it hard to see. My husband and I had taken a trip to the beach and I could not see my screen even under the umbrella. I had thought about a Paperwhite, but wasn't sure I would get a lot of use out of it. My new "regular" Kindle is often and gets used quiete a bit for the internet, games, and yes reading, some days I run the battery pretty low, this was just another excuse to add a Paperwhite. I ordered a refurbished one hoping I really could see it in bright sun. WOW, I can see it even better than a paper page and there is no reflective glare. I love it! I hope I don't need the water protection feature, but let's face it the bright sun is usually near water. I am very happy with my purchase. I did order a regular wall power cord as I don't like charging off my computer, but all is well and I really love the Paperwhire, the only regret is that it took me so long to buy one.
postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019

reviewTitles: Outdated software and perpetual ad bombardment
reviewBody: This refurb version has some cons that make it worth considering the purchase of a new one. I originally decided to purchase a refurb for the environmental reuse benefit, and will keep it for that reason, but be warned: 1.) The software will be out of date and the device will malfunction upon receipt. Spend an hour with their custom support and you'll probably get it figured out. This happened with both of my purchases of this item, but only the second time was the support rep able to figure it out, and 2. Your screen will constantly show ads (like the image for this review), unless you pay Amazon $20 for the ability to remove them.
